content: If a car travels at an average speed of 60 mph for 3 hours, how far does it travel?

If a car travels at an average speed of 60 miles per hour (mph) for 3 hours, the distance it covers can be calculated using the formula:

\[ \text{Distance} = \text{Speed} \times \text{Time} \]

Plugging in the given values:

\[ \text{Distance} = 60 \, \text{mph} \times 3 \, \text{hours} = 180 \, \text{miles} \]

So, the car travels 180 miles.
